entry.tran: （一人弯腰、另一人从其背上跳过的）跳背游戏
entry.def: Leapfrog is a game which children play, in which a child bends over, while others jump over their back.

example.ex: ...children engaged in activities such as riding, playing leapfrog, or football.
example.tran: 在玩骑马、跳背和足球等的孩子们

entry.def: If one group of people leapfrogs into a particular position or leapfrogs someone else, they use the achievements of another person or group in order to make advances of their own.

example.ex: It is already obvious that all four American systems have leapfrogged over the European versions...
example.tran: 4个美国系统全部超过了欧洲版本，这已是显见的事实。

example.ex: American researchers have now leapfrogged the Japanese and are going to produce a digital system within a year or two.
example.tran: 美国研究人员现已乘日本人之东风赶超而上，将在一两年内研制出一套数字系统。

means.word_mean: 1. advancing as if in the game of leapfrog
2. a game in which one child bends down and another leaps over
2. progress by large jumps instead of small increments
